profile: With professional, dedicated plumbing service to all major cities and surrounding areas in Alberta, and with some of the best plumbers in the industry, The Gentlemen Plumbers work hard to exceed your expectations and deliver quality. If you need a plumber, call us today for plumbing or heating issues, leaky sinks and faucets, clogged drains, toilet, bathtub and shower repairs, furnace cleaning and repairs, hot water tanks and tankless hot water heaters, furnace installation and maintenance, trenchless pipe repair, camera sewer inspection, and more! We have local branches in Calgary, Edmonton, Red Deer, Lethbridge, and Medicine Hat, with extended service all over Southern Alberta, including Camrose, Sherwood Park, St. Albert, Airdrie, High River, Crossfield, Carstairs, Olds, Innisfail, Wetaskiwin, Leduc, Lacombe, Okotoks, Nanton, Taber, Cardston, Didsbury, Brooks, Crowsnest Pass, Cochrane, Strathmore, Sundre, Three Hills, Ponoka, Fort Macleod, Pincher Creek, Bowden, Fort Saskatchewan, Chestermere, Sylvan Lake, Spruce Grove, and Stony Plain.

profile:
Doing it right, is our craft. At The Honest Electrician Inc. we pride ourselves on providing high quality electrical services that combine value, safety and peace of mind. While building relationships that ensure the safety and quality of life to our clients and the generations to come.

Over 30 Years of Combined Electrical Experience, Master Electrician since 2008. Certified Journeyman since 2004 at Red Deer College. Very knowledgeable on Canadian Electrical Code and City of Calgary Standata Requirements. Recently upgraded Canadian Electrical Code at SAIT with a course called "What's New in the Code" Renovation specialist, Aluminum wiring repairs, garage wiring, basement wiring, insurance service upgrades, hot tub wiring and other electrical service calls.  Boiler systems, commercial and industrial distribution systems.  Registered instrumentation apprentice with 5 years experience in installation, calibration and trouble shooting of various instruments.

Safety is Our Main Priority
The Honest Electrician is licensed, bonded, insured, and WCB covered. This means there’s no risk to you or your business should anything untoward ever happen while we’re carrying out electrical work on your property. We are also trained in the operation of specialty equipment, such as aerial work platforms. 

Industrial & Supervisory Experience
The Honest Electrician has a diverse industrial background spanning multiple industries. He began his career as a construction electrician for various diamond mines, then moved onto oilfield electrical operations work. Kyle then became an Electrical Foreman/Superintendent for three ongoing projects at the Cameco uranium mines in northern Saskatchewan, where he oversaw two teams of 15 workers. After concluding his supervisor work at Cameco, Kyle went on to become an underground mine electrician for Tron Power. He then returned to the oilpatch as a sub-contractor working for CNRL, Seven Generations, and Encana. 

Commercial Electrical Experience
Kyle Moss, aka The Honest Electrician, has extensive and varied experience working on commercial projects. This includes electrical rough-in work for the TransCanada Tower and Nexen Building in downtown Calgary, and the power distribution system for the Sears expansion at Southcentre Mall. The Honest Electrician has also completed commercial work on the South Health Campus hospital, Glenmore Water Treatment Plant, University of Calgary, and the Calgary International Airport. With a proven track record of completing commercial work on time and on budget, The Honest Electrician can be trusted for your next big job. 

100% Satisfaction Guaranteed 
Staying true to our name every project or piece of electrical work we complete is 100% guaranteed. If you aren’t satisfied with the job we do (but we know you will be), then we’ll redo the work free of charge or refund your money. 

Commercial Case Study: The Honest Electrician Helped Mountain Mercato in Canmore Stop Experiencing Power Interruptions While Using Their Induction Hot Plates
The specialty food market and café were constantly tripping their main breaker anytime they used their induction hot plates for cooking, which caused everything in the store to come to a standstill. Fed up with the problem, Mountain Mercato called The Honest Electrician to see if he could help. The Honest Electrician immediately recognized the issue; a previously installed 120/208VAC three-phase power system had been poorly balanced. The Honest Electrician spent two hours taking various readings, then moved some breakers around to better balance the system. Mountain Mercato hasn’t tripped their main breaker while using induction hot plates ever since.
